UNIFIED MESSAGING
Email Engagement Data in Unified Messaging

Unified Messaging captures email engagement data in two data model objects (DMOs) in Data Cloud. Every send or interaction with your email messaging activities generates this information. You can use these fields to segment audiences or populate reports on your messaging activities.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Unified Messaging for WhatsApp is available in Enterprise and Unlimited Editions for Marketing Cloud Engagement and Service Cloud Digital Engagement
Unified Messaging for Email and SMS is available in Enterprise and Unlimited Editions for Marketing Cloud Growth
Not supported in Government Cloud Plus
EmailEngagement DMO

This DMO contains information on six different email engagement event types.

SendStatus - the final status of a message’s delivery attempt to each recipient
Bounce - a sent email message couldn’t be delivered to an inbox
Open - an email message is opened
Click - a link in an email message is clicked
Unsubscribe - a recipient opts out of further messaging as a result of a send
Complaint - a recipient registers a complaint about a message with their service provider

All send types include this information.

FIELDS	DESCRIPTION
EventID	Unique identifier for the specific event
EventType	The type of event that occurred
EventDateTime	Timestamp indicating when the event occurred
IndividualID	Unique individual associated with the event
ContactPointEmailAddress	Recipient email address used in the send
ContactPointID	Identifier of the contact point record that was used for the send
BulkEmailMessageID	A unique identifier for the send entity associated with the engagement event. Each BulkEmailMessage in Data Cloud is associated with a ListEmail object. Context information about a Flow Send Email action is captured to a unique ListEmail object when the Flow is activated.
RecipientMessageID	Identifier for the unique instance of a send to a specific recipient

Some fields in the EmailEngagement DMO are specific only to certain event types.

EVENTTYPE	FIELD NAME	DESCRIPTION	VALUES
Bounce	BounceType	Type of bounce the email message experienced	
BOUNCE_TYPE_NONE
BOUNCE_TYPE_HARD
BOUNCE_TYPE_SOFT

BounceReason	Information on why the email couldn’t be delivered	
Click	LinkURL	The URL that was clicked, not including any tracking parameters	
RecipientIP	IP address of the recipient that clicked the link	
ResolvedURL	URL that was clicked, including tracking parameters	
UserAgent	Browser-provided information about the device, operating system, browser, and mail client used when the message was clicked. Salesforce doesn’t guarantee the accuracy or completeness of this data. Use as reference only.	
Open	RecipientIP	IP address of the recipient that opened the message	
UserAgent	Browser-provided information about the device, operating system, browser, and mail client used when the message was opened. Salesforce doesn’t guarantee the accuracy or completeness of this data. Use as reference only.	
SendStatus	SendStatus	Status of the delivery attempt for a message to a specific recipient. We generate one SendStatus event result per recipient attempted for each send.	
SENT
NOT_SENT
TEST_SENT
TEST_NOT_SENT

NotSentReason	Reason the send didn’t occur	
Message expired
Invalid From Address
Send limit exceeded
Email address not opted-in
Prior hard bounce
Invalid message

Unsubscribe	UnsubscribeSource	The location where the unsubscribe request took place	
Preference Center
Client Header
Keyword Reply
Spam Complaint

Complaint	ComplaintSource	Location where the complaint occurred	
BulkEmailMessage DMO

This DMO contains contextual information on the send itself.

FIELD	DESCRIPTION
BulkEmailMessageID	A unique identifier for the send entity associated with the engagement event
SendName	A user-provided name associated with the send, as indicated by the Send Email action’s Label in Flow
FromName	From name associated with the send
FromAddress	From address associated with the send
MessagePurpose	Purpose of email message
Subject	String contained in email subject line
ManagedContentID	A unique identifier for the email content used for the send
MarketSegmentID	The unique identifier of the target segment associated with the email send
FlowElementRunID	A unique identifier for the specific run of the flow that sent the email message
CampaignID	Unique identifier for campaign associated with the send
Sample Use Case

After the events take place, you can use the data captured to create segments for use in sending targeted messages. For example, you can create a segment of unified individuals based on who clicked links from your messages at least three times in the past month. Segment on the EventDateTime value associated with the Open event types, then collect the IndividualID values to determine who receives further messages.

Let us know so we can improve!

No
title: Understanding Email Engagement Data in Unified Messaging
